clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Pharmacokinetic Study for Dapivirine and Maraviroc Gel in Belgium
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomised, Placebo-Controlled Phase I Trial to Compare the Pharmacokinetics of Maraviroc and Dapivirine Following Application of Maraviroc Vaginal Vaginal Gel, 0.1% 2.5g, Dapivirine Vaginal Gel, 0.05%, 2.5g and Maraviroc 0.1% + Dapivirine 0.05% Vaginal Gel, 2.5g Formulations, and to Assess Their Safety as Compared to the Matching Placebo Vaginal Gel, 2.5g in Healthy, HIV-Negative Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the pharmacokinetics of the combination dapivirine and maraviroc gel and determine whether it is safe for daily use by healthy women in the United Kingdom

clinical_study.why_stopped: In order to focus efforts on the combination ring formulation, IPM decided not to move forward with this trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: To assess the safety and tolerability of the combination maraviroc and dapivirine gel, the endpoint was the proportion of women in the four arms experiencing specific, protocol defined safety events during the study (see description).
Pharmacokinetics: assessment of local and systemic pharmacokinetics of maraviroc and dapivirine in plasma, vaginal fluid and cervical tissue before, during and after 11 days.
